channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024021525
item.description:
Report X-2024021525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler was unloading a trailer when they noticed that there was a wet spot on it and informed a manager who then alerted a hazmat team member. It was then placed inside a yellow drum and then placed in the hazmat cage sealed under ventilation. DescribePack: All four of the caps were loose on the products. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put in a yellow hazmat drum and put into the hazmat cage under ventilation

item.title: Report X-2024020851
item.description:
Report X-2024020851

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the package soiled as soon as it was offloaded from trailer, used proper PPE to handle pkg and places in a salvage drum to stop any further leaking if any. DescribePack: the glass container inside the package had a loose cap, causing it to spill out half of its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed package in a salvage drum to mitigate further spilling if any.

item.title: Report X-2024020736
item.description:
Report X-2024020736

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During preload sort on 01/30/2024, a fully regulated Hazmat package was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents. After discovery, damaged package was taken to QA for inspection DescribePack: Four litter bottle of LabChem Isopropyl Alcohol, 70% leakinmg contents from loose cap inside package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After discovery, damaged package placed in a red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing by QA.

item.title: Report X-2024020634
item.description:
Report X-2024020634

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: BLAUVELT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ABOUT 7:27 AM, MANAGER CALL QA TO THE BELT Q, THERE WAS A HAZMAT LEAKING. THE HAZMAT WAS PLACE ON THE TUGGER. LOADED THE CONVEYOR BELT. THE MANAGER OBSERVED THE BOX IS WET OUT. QA OPENED THE BOX AND OBSERVED THERE WAS A PRECATALYZED CLEAR LACQUER FOR WOOD FLOOR. TOOK THE PAIL, PUT THE PAIL IN A RED BIN AND PROCEED TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. NO LEAKING ON THE FLOOR. ONLY THE BOX WAS WET. DescribePack: THE BOX WAS WET. THE PAIL HAD A DENT ON THE BOTTON. 44.10 POUNDS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT THE PAIL IN A RED BIN.

item.title: Report X-2024020619
item.description:
Report X-2024020619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was sent over the HITTS sorter and was crushed by another package when discovered on load side 2 was promptly cleaned up in house. DescribePack: The cap was loose already and when the package was hit it caused a leak from the closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called and promptly cleaned up all remnants of the spill.
